sections.MISSION: K TRP, 3/2CR conducts a M2 Machine Gun and MK19 range for all Soldiers at Range 311 on 05 OCT 2023. This range will give Troopers an opportunity to qualify on the dismounted M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 weapon systems.
sections.END STATE:
All M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 gunners are qualified.
Training Objectives: All M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 gunners throughout the Regiment are able to engage targets and qualify on their weapon systems.
Task Organization:
OIC: 1LT Wuerthner RSO: SSG Garcia
NCOIC: SFC Pelletier Medical: CPL Stovall Primary Safeties: SGT Cravens, SGT Voss, SGT Mendoza, SGT Zinke, SGT Torres, CPL Holsinger Ammo Handlers: SGT Montlavo, SGT Anderson
Additional range support provided by 3rd PLT Kronos.
2 Pax Gate Guard 2 Pax for Score Keeping
1 PAX RTO 3 PAX Ammo Point
Timeline:
0600- Range Detail SP to Range 311. 0700- Ammo Drop off
0830- Initial trainees arrive on range
0850- Safety Brief
0900- Range Hot/First Round Down Range
1700- Range Cold/End of Training
1705- Police Call
1730- Ammo Pick up
1800- All Paxs RTB
Ammo Allocation: 36 Allotted Shooters
49 Requested

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Proper uniform: Full Dragoon Standard for Qualification.
Thorough safety briefing for both firers and range safeties.
Qualified combat life Saver/ medic will know MEDEVAC procedures.
PCIs will be conducted prior to entering range. Range safeties will be on lanes.
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs on lane safety.

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Brief procedures for malfunction/ misfire, conduct proper PMI and concurrent training
Ensure weapons and ammo are clean before use.
Safety Brief, Proper PMI training, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Brief range limits and cease fire procedures movement downrange will be controlled by the range safeties
Safety brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Safeties check for hearing protection, to ensure Troopers have standard issue protection or they will be provided hearing protection prior to firing weapon.
PCCs/PCIs, Extra Hearing Protection available at range, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Firers will wear approved ballistic eyewear while at the range to prevent expelled brass, dirt, dust, and debris from damaging their eyes
PCIs, Lane Safeties, Safety Validation exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

subtask.name: M2 Machine Gun and MK-19 Qualification

values: Ammo will not be placed on the ground, Provide adequate guards for ammo while range is not occupied.
All ammo handling procedures will be followed for transport, storage, and distribution.
Range Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Follow procedures when loading, firing, and unloading weapons.
Remind Soldiers to consider weapons loaded at all times and to check chambers often.
Safety Brief.
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Range will cease fire with severe weather. Range OIC will contact GTA range operations desk if the weather is called into question.
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

Convoy leaders will give ramp brief prior to movement. Vehicle Crews will wear all required PPE while operating tactical vehicles. Vehicles will follow range roads and use ground guides in parking areas.
Ramp Brief, Proper PPE, Ground Guides, Follow Roads
Vehicle Crews, Convoy Leaders, Gate Guard, RSO
